perturbation.original_text:
Converge agrees to install in the recommend environments all Maintenance Updates within a reasonable time following the date they are provided by VNE, taking into consideration any testing and customization required by Converge (the parties expect that the time for such installation

generally will not exceed 90 days). Should Converge find one or more material deficiencies in any Maintenance Update, Converge shall promptly identify such deficiencies to VNE in reasonable detail.
perturbation.changed_text:
Converge agrees to install in the recommend environments all Maintenance Updates within a reasonable time following the date they are provided by VNE, taking into consideration any testing and customization required by Converge (the parties expect that the time for such installation

generally will not exceed 180 days). Should Converge find one or more material deficiencies in any Maintenance Update, Converge may identify such deficiencies to VNE at their convenience.
perturbation.explanation: This change extends the allowed installation time for Maintenance Updates to 180 days, which could be an unreasonably long period depending on the nature of the software and the urgency of the updates, potentially conflicting with industry standards or implied warranties of timely support. Additionally, modifying 'promptly identify' to 'identify at their convenience' significantly weakens the obligation to report issues, impacting support effectiveness.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied warranty of timely support and industry standards for software maintenance (UCC Article 2).

perturbation.original_text: Thereafter, Converge shall pay each such Monthly Installment to VNE no later than the first day of each month during the Initial Term (November 2001 and through March 2003). All such Monthly Installments are non-refundable.
perturbation.changed_text: Thereafter, Converge shall pay each such Monthly Installment to VNE at the company's discretion. All such Monthly Installments are non-refundable.
perturbation.explanation: This change makes the payment date for monthly installments discretionary, which could be interpreted as a violation of contract law principles requiring definite payment terms. The payments being non-refundable remains.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Basic contract law principle requiring definite payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: In the event of any breach of the foregoing warranty, and provided that Converge reports such breach to VNE in writing within 90 days following the date of performance of the Services in question, VNE shall, as its sole obligation and Converge's sole and exclusive remedy, promptly repair, replace or re-perform the Services in question, without additional cost to Converge, so as to correct the warranty non-compliance as promptly as practicable (within 30 days to the extent technically feasible).
perturbation.changed_text: In the event of any breach of the foregoing warranty, and provided that Converge reports such breach to VNE in writing within 300 days following the date of performance of the Services in question, VNE shall, as its sole obligation and Converge's sole and exclusive remedy, address the services in question within 180 days, so as to correct the warranty non-compliance as they see fit.
perturbation.explanation: The changes significantly alter the warranty breach reporting and correction timeline, potentially undermining the warranty's effectiveness. Increasing the reporting timeframe to 300 days may be deemed unreasonable, while changing the correction timeframe to '180 days' weakens the 'promptly' language, potentially conflicting with consumer protection laws or reasonable expectations of timely service remediation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Consumer protection laws regarding reasonable warranty remedies and implied warranties of service quality.
